title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki - XWiki
content:
00:41 <vmassol> has quit  
00:56 <DrLou> has quit  
01:11 <arbaciauskas> is it possbile to have 2 forms in html for creating a new document and only one submit button  
01:11 <arbaciauskas> ?  
01:11 <arbaciauskas> could that work some how?

10:18 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
10:21 <+mflorea> cjdelisle: did you encounter any issues during the 3.1M1 release due to the Git move?  
10:21 <@cjdelisle> A few small things which I fixed along the way.  
10:22 <@cjdelisle> Lemme make sure I pulled the patches into trunk...  
10:22 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
10:22 <+mflorea> ok  
10:23 <+mflorea> We need to release 2.7.2. I guess we won't have big problems.  
10:25 <Enygma`1> has joined #xwiki  
10:26 <@cjdelisle> Nope, it should be pretty easy. Just modify the parent version and the versions of commons and platform where appropriate  
10:30 <Enygma`> has quit  
10:39 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
10:42 <abusenius> has joined #xwiki  
10:43 <@cjdelisle> https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-rendering/commit/df5eb5c10995889265a096c4fed0168fae487131  
10:43 <@cjdelisle> https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/bb61cf3e1de6b2eb167381eeae84b81fc4a4bf0b  
10:44 <@cjdelisle> https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-enterprise/commit/6210c7f6c600ff214790e121f8b24f8e8b5d9175  
10:44 <@cjdelisle> https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-manager/commit/7350f0a129d399b3dd84f18881e1ae0d2187ed6e  
10:44 <@cjdelisle> those are the commits for setting the versions for release.  
10:46 <@cjdelisle> I don't see a 2.7 branch  
10:47 <@cjdelisle> ahh it's just not there for rendering  
10:47 <@sdumitriu> Rendering is new  
10:48 <@sdumitriu> So all that needs to be released is platform, enterprise, manager  
10:48 <@sdumitriu> Only three releases :)  
10:48 <@cjdelisle> ok, merging some pom.xml bugfixes  
10:52 <vmassol1> has joined #xwiki  
10:52 <vmassol> has quit  
10:54 <vmassol1> sdumitriu: does this work (not tried it myself):  
10:54 <vmassol1> -@Component(roles = ScriptService.class, hints = "csrf")  
10:54 <vmassol1>    
10:54 <vmassol1> 37  
10:54 <vmassol1> +@Component(roles = ScriptService.class)  
10:54 <vmassol1>    
10:54 <vmassol1> 38  
10:54 <vmassol1> +@Named("csrf")  
10:54 <@sdumitriu> Me neither  
10:54 <@cjdelisle> Not sure where/how/if this should be merged into 2.7 https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/1c7dee6bf783ccc2171374908ba34d4edb064b09  
10:55 <vmassol1> there might have been a good reason we used hints  
10:55 <@sdumitriu> cjdelisle: It shouldn't, since all projects in commons are inside platform for 2.7  
10:55 <vmassol1> sdumitriu: just read the javadoc  
10:55 <vmassol1>      \* Sometimes you want to register the component several times with different hints. In this case the  
10:55 <vmassol1>      \* default annotation value is ignored and the passed list of hints is used instead.  
10:56 <vmassol1> it seems it's the same as hint if there's only 1 entry  
10:56 <vmassol1> so should be fine I guess  
10:56 <vmassol1> we don't support multiples hints though with @Named right now  
10:57 <vmassol1> ah there's a problem  
10:57 <vmassol1> you've now created 2 singeltons  
10:57 <vmassol1> whereas we had only 1 before  
10:58 <vmassol1> ah no my bad  
10:58 <vmassol1> you've kept roles so it should be fine  
10:58 <vmassol1> :)  
10:58 <jvdrean> has joined #xwiki  
10:58 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
10:59 <vmassol1> ok should be fine i guess… I had pushed converting this use case to later… ;)  
11:06 <vmassol1> cjdelisle: your commit bf01981aa702cdb33c9b90c9e7bbf17885e8026a is strange an d I think wrong  
11:06 <vmassol1> +  <version>3.1M1-SNAPSHOT</version>  
11:06 <vmassol1> on master it should be 3.1-SNAPSHOT  
11:07 <vmassol1> ah you fixed it ;)  
11:23 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
11:54 <mflorea> has quit  
11:58 <vmassol1> has quit  
12:03 <Chami> has joined #xwiki  
12:13 <florinciu> has joined #xwiki  
12:13 <Chami> tmortagne: hi  
12:13 <+tmortagne> Chami: hi  
12:13 <Chami> you said to work on a jira issue  
12:14 <Chami> can you describe more about it  
12:14 <Chami> that page does not provide much information about the issue  
12:14 <Chami> http://jira.xwiki.org/jira/browse/XWIKI-5970  
12:14 <Chami> tmortagne: yeah it is  
12:15 <Chami> can you tell me the source code which I have to look up  
12:15 <Chami> i mean the xwiki-platform directory  
12:17 <+tmortagne> Chami: I don't know well issue since I'm not the one who reported it but what I understand is that when you use REST to do a search in a space containg "+" it will actually search a space with a white space  
12:18 <Chami> tmortagne: so should I look into REST source code?  
12:18 <+tmortagne> Chami: first you should try to reproduce  
12:19 <+tmortagne> then find where exactly the issue is, and it's probably in the REST module yes  
12:19 <Chami> tmortagne: ok, i'll try  
12:19 <+tmortagne> since this search issue is only in REST  
12:19 <Chami> tmortagne: thank you  
12:19 <+tmortagne> Chami: this issue has been created by sdumitriu if have more question oon how to reproduce it  
12:22 <Chami> tmortagne: is he online?  
12:23 <+tmortagne> Chami: yes he is (technically at least) as far as I can see in my IRC client  
12:23 <+tmortagne> sdumitriu ?  
12:31 <@sdumitriu> In a training, brb  
12:42 <@cjdelisle> http://www.cs.umass.edu/~mcorner/courses/691J/papers/TS/coffman\_deadlocks/coffman\_deadlocks.pdf  
13:00 <asyd> screen

14:13 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
14:29 <sdumitriu> has joined #xwiki  
14:53 <abusenius\_> has joined #xwiki  
14:54 <abusenius> has quit  
14:54 <abusenius\_> is now known as <abusenius>  
15:00 <+tmortagne> sdumitriu: I can't find any  working way to ignore src/main/java/META-INF/ I committed something in the .gitignore according to the documentation (plus checked with jetty eclipse plugin which have the same thing) but it does not seems to work so if you have an idea...  
15:01 <@sdumitriu> What did you put in .gitignore?  
15:02 <@sdumitriu> Did you push to github already?  
15:02 <+tmortagne> yes i pushed it  
15:02 <@sdumitriu> K, looking  
15:02 <+tmortagne> \*/src/main/java/META-INF/  
15:03 <+tmortagne> i tried  
15:03 <+tmortagne> src/main/java/META-INF/  
15:03 <+tmortagne> too  
15:03 <+tmortagne> but same thing  
15:03 <+tmortagne> even /\*\*/src/main/java/META-INF/  
15:07 <@sdumitriu> tmortagne: How is it listed in "git status"?  
15:07 <@sdumitriu> (copy/paste)  
15:08 <+tmortagne> http://pastebin.com/yLSvQQj4  
15:08 <+tmortagne> so listed like any new file  
15:08 <+tmortagne> well folders in this case  
15:09 <@sdumitriu> Works with  
15:09 <@sdumitriu> META-INF/  
15:09 <@sdumitriu> But this means that all metainfs will be ignored  
15:09 <+tmortagne> sure we don't want that  
15:09 <+tmortagne> since we have valid metainf insresources  
15:13 <@sdumitriu> We can ignore all META-INF and unignore specific directories  
15:14 <+tmortagne> what I don't understand is that i can find example looking pretty much like what I'm trying to do so it's supposed to be supported  
15:14 <@sdumitriu> Hm, that would be too bad  
15:14 <@sdumitriu> All the components.txt are in META-INF  
15:15 <+tmortagne> yes that's the valid one I was talking about  
15:15 <+abusenius> how about /\*/\*/\*/src/main/java/META-INF/ ?  
15:16 <@sdumitriu> That should work  
15:16 <@sdumitriu> If we have don't go into submodules  
15:16 <+tmortagne> abusenius: that's pretty much useless since it means only only some specific level  
15:16 <+tmortagne> and /\*\*/src/main/java/META-INF/ does not work even if the doc is pretty clera about the fact that \*\* means any number of folders  
15:16 <+abusenius> well, it doesn't support globbing with multiple subdirectories  
15:17 <+abusenius> (afaik)  
15:18 <+abusenius> we will not have an arbitrary number of subdirs, maybe just 2-5  
15:18 <+abusenius> 5 lines aren't so bad  
15:19 <+tmortagne> hmm can't find \*\* in the man anymore, don't rememebr where I seen it  
15:20 <@sdumitriu> tmortagne: Try this:  
15:20 <@sdumitriu> # Automatically generated by WTP  
15:20 <@sdumitriu> /\*/\*/\*/\*/\*/src/main/java/META-INF/  
15:20 <@sdumitriu> /\*/\*/\*/\*/src/main/java/META-INF/  
15:20 <@sdumitriu> /\*/\*/\*/src/main/java/META-INF/  
15:20 <@sdumitriu> /\*/\*/src/main/java/META-INF/  
15:20 <+tmortagne> trying  
15:21 <@sdumitriu> tmortagne: I think that changed  
15:21 <+tmortagne> "git treats the pattern as a shell glob"  
15:22 <+tmortagne> seems to work  
15:22 <+tmortagne> at least that's a solution even if it's not pretty, thanks abusenius and sdumitriu  
15:26 <+tmortagne> pushed  
15:53 <lucaa> has quit  
16:06 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
16:11 <+tmortagne> EGit see things like "@version $Id: f601e321d7b978c33e9216eb8bf8f9a88dde416d $" as modifications, it's a bit of a pain. Hope they will fix it soon...  
16:12 <@sdumitriu> Strange...  
16:12 <@sdumitriu> Did you checkout with console git or with egit?  
16:13 <+tmortagne> i just did a pull with git  
16:13 <+tmortagne> and now egit sees a lot of modifications  
16:13 <+tmortagne> it's doing that for each pull now...  
16:13 <+tmortagne> git status is ok so it's really a egit issue  
16:15 <@sdumitriu> http://netbeans.org/bugzilla/show\_bug.cgi?id=196315  
16:16 <+tmortagne> yea looks like it

17:34 <vmassol1> has joined #xwiki  
17:34 <vmassol> has quit  
17:36 <@sdumitriu> Who pushed this? https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/compare/8c5a4c8%5E...428a9dd  
17:38 <+tmortagne> not sure it's me but I had a merge issue at some point I reverted but maybe it kept the merge in the history and created another commit to revert it  
17:39 <+tmortagne> when did the push has been done ?  
17:40 <@sdumitriu> 4:08PM  
17:40 <@sdumitriu> No, 3:05Pm  
17:40 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
17:40 <vmassol1> has quit  
17:40 <@sdumitriu> On the 3.1M1 branch, which no longer exists  
17:40 <@sdumitriu> Maybe you did a push without pruning the remote branches first  
17:41 <vmassol> has quit  
17:41 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
17:41 <+tmortagne> I did a general push at some point before seing that 3.1M1 was deleted  
17:41 <+tmortagne> did a pull before but that does not deleted branches  
17:42 <+tmortagne> it's very confusing  
17:42 <@sdumitriu> pull --prune  
17:42 <+tmortagne> all the time ?  
17:42 <@sdumitriu> Yep, it's a good idea  
17:42 <vmassol1> has joined #xwiki  
17:42 <@sdumitriu> Make an alias for it  
17:42 <vmassol> has quit  
17:42 <+tmortagne> there is a way to do that by default (i.e. that egit do it)  
17:44 <@sdumitriu> git config --global alias.up 'pull --rebase --prune'  
17:44 <@sdumitriu> I don't know if egit uses .gitconfig  
17:45 <@sdumitriu> By the way, what's your experience with egit? Is it OK?  
17:45 <+tmortagne> sdumitriu: well no bbug so that which is a good thing already since it's using a complete reqrite of git in java (jgit)  
17:46 <+tmortagne> problems:  
17:46 <+tmortagne> - the synchronize view is a bit messy right now  
17:46 <+tmortagne> - when you commit you don't have the list of previous commit messages  
17:47 <+tmortagne> - I don't undertand why but the history view make Eclipse super slow  
17:48 <+tmortagne> for example you want to get the history of a file to get previous versions and each time you click on any  version without even loading the file content Eclipse is stuck for several seconds  
17:49 <vmassol1> has quit  
17:49 <+tmortagne> - there is @version issue which is the most painful one right now  
17:50 <+tmortagne> good supprises:  
17:50 <+tmortagne> - checkout work pretty well  
17:50 <+tmortagne> if you except the history view and the synchronize the performance is pretty good  
17:51 <+tmortagne> they don't release very often, I never have an upgrade since I installed it  
17:51 <+tmortagne> s/have/had/  
17:51 <@sdumitriu> There aren't enough people on it  
17:52 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
17:52 <@sdumitriu> Which is a bit strange, since git is very popular  
17:52 <+tmortagne> yep  
17:52 <@sdumitriu> But then most git users are writing C and Ruby, not Java  
17:52 <+tmortagne> well that's not fully true, a lots of big java project are moving to github  
17:57 <+tmortagne> just rewrite git in java is already a big work I guess
